intro: Schizoloma alutaceum, commonly known as the slender earthstar, is a unique fungal plant that belongs to the family Sarcinocephalaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-like structure that resembles a small, fleshy umbrella. The fruiting body consists of a central stem with radiating spore-bearing segments called rays. It typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest floors. This rare and delicate organism plays a role in decomposing organic matter in its ecosystem.
